sentences.en: Abraham Lincoln was born on February 12 th, 1809.
Average weekly cinema attendance in February was 2.41 million.
sentences.cn: 2月份，平均每周的观影人数为241万。

sentences.en: Britain converted to decimal currency on February 15 th, 1971.
sentences.cn: 英国于1971年2月15日改用十进位币制.

sentences.en: He joined the Army in February 1943.
He was jailed in February 1992 and could be released next year.
sentences.cn: 他于1992年2月入狱，可能明年获释。

sentences.en: In February 1967 he introduced the Shipbuilding Industry Bill.
sentences.cn: 1967年2月,他提出了造船工业议案.

sentences.en: It begins in [ with ] February , running on to August or September.
sentences.cn: 它始于 2月, 一直延续至8月或9月.

sentences.en: It should have been all over with and forgotten by the first of last February.
sentences.cn: 它早该在去年二月的第一天就结束了，然后被人忘得无影无踪。

sentences.en: So let us pray together on this February morning, but let us also work together in all the days and months ahead.
sentences.cn: 因此，在今天这个二月的早晨，让我们一起祈祷，而且也让我们在今后的岁月里一起工作。

sentences.en: Sow the seed in a warm place in February/March.
sentences.cn: 2月或3月里把种子播种在温暖的地方。

sentences.en: The car ferries from the mainland are often fully booked by February.
sentences.cn: 从大陆出发的汽车轮渡常常在2月前就被预订一空。

sentences.en: The charge was that, in February 1975, he had leaked a restricted document to a journalist.
sentences.cn: 对他的指控是他在1975年2月将一份保密文件泄露给了一位记者。

sentences.en: The February air was soft, cool, and inviting.
sentences.cn: 二月的空气柔和、凉爽而怡人。

sentences.en: The Parliament was prorogued to the tenth of February.
These trees come into leaf in February.
This warm weather is abnormal for February.
sentences.cn: 二月里这种温暖的天气不太正常.

trans.tran_en: the second month of the year, between January and March
the second month of the year, between January and March
